reviews.text: The site is very interesting if you are really into Maya culture but is unkeep. There are few workers .

If you are in Flores, and looking for something interesting to do visiting these caves is a great option. It’s just a short tuk tuk ride there. The caves are pretty extensive but easy to navigate through. You’ll find bats, and we also saw a couple of cave spiders. Outside the caves are some nice garden areas to hang out for a bit. Afterward you can just walk a few miles back to the island or if you start walking you’ll find a cheap ride back pretty easy.
It's awsome! No lighting just your own spotlight, sometimes really tight so you have to crawl on all four or even slide on your belly. It's a real experience of caving!

Amazing, You will definitely have an amazing experience in this cave. You and your light will have more than 2 hours of walking around this cave to discover all the shapes it has on the rocks. Don't forget to bring water and closed shoes and a great camera to take your photos and see how the cave still has some gold in the rocks. Whoops, it seems the Spanish forgot to check there. Enjoy!

A neat cave to explore if you are visiting the area and have time. It is reasonably priced, and has some interesting features. The map on the outside is a little worn, so be sure to pay attention to the numbers in order to find your way out.
Wonderful community place. Great food available.
I was there (about 11 am) during a clean up from a previous night's event.  It was dirty and unattractive; the clean up should have been completed by 8 am.  The Cathedral was clean-unscathed.
It’s pretty, cool place.
Beautiful place í recommend it
Relaxing and unique

Graeat luscious garden with many, many bungalows. Very good breakfast-  western and asian. Good coffee, smoking is otside but there are also good seatings. Motorbike and car rent from the resort. Beautiful and clean pool. Room service- 8 of 10 but decent. Room service with food ordering. Good food. Tasted only local though. Public toilets- 7 of 10. Nice and quiet resort to stay in this busy town. 7 eleven is just few hundred meters around the corner if needed.

Gardens were absolutely lovely, rooms great and beds nice. Pool was good. Only issue was the noise from neighbouring rooms... could hear everything in adjoining rooms. They were doing some rennovation so hopefully an issue being addressed.

Room was great, renovated recently and had one of those rainfall showers. Very clean. I ordered a Thai foot massage and a glass of wine at the end of the night, it was EVERYTHING! Hotel staff is very friendly, service is superb - I will definitely be coming back next time I’m in Chiang Rai.

The pool villas have paper wall's and can hear every single word from the room next door. The room maids start working at 7am and talking and laughing super loud that sleeping impossible. The massage chair in the lobby offer the service for 10THB but only eat money and not work and if ask the concierge on the counter he answer: not my business???
And even know it's broken still let it run to cheat next guest???
All in one it's for the price the most worth Hotel I ever was here in Chiang Rai.
Will sure never meet again!!!!
Lacking atmosphere despite lovely gardens.  Feels a bit like a retirement village; staff lacking in customer service skills.

Very friendly stuff and cool atmosphere. They have house specials were you get a meal plus a drink/beer for a very fair price. The food might only be avarage, but you get really large portions for a cheap price. They even have some TVs to watch live sport.
Great food! Large portions and an excellent beer menu. Went there 3 or 4 times as we stayed in Flores. It helps that it is one of the cheaper places in Flores as well!
I love this place! The coffee is great and I just finished their eggplant dinner. Perfect.
Great vibes, nice patio with hammocks. Good coffee, best beer selection on the island. Food is below par bar grub though; go for drinks only.

All food is really not good.
Place is nice though.
The coffee tastes like the water you get after washing dirty socks.

Cheap private room, but it was very noisy at night and early in the morning. People working there were always walking in front of the door and talking, and it is not the cleanest place. But for 100Q a night for both of us, for 1 night it was ok. If you are on a budget and want a private room, it does the job. Cheaper than hostels.
Perfect location. Basic amenities. Fun place. Wonderful terrace.
Basic hostel with not many people there when we stayed there. They didnt have filtered water that sucks but the common areas were nice and the private rooms with bathrooms are nice.
While we went kayaking, someone broke door and stole our money. It's very famous hotel as rubber, we knew it after the rubbery
Great hotel, backpacker friendly too, only let down was sewage smell in the shower
